intro: Aspidosperma lucentivenium, commonly known as the luminous spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic alkaloids. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Due to its toxic properties, it is not commonly cultivated but is of interest in botanical and pharmacological research.
